title: Help identify font in school logo
content:
I am using one of our older school logos to create an anniversary logo for our school's 25th anniversary. I can not figure out what font was used. I would appreciate any help.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014195202/http:/typophile.com/files/typo_23.jpg) | 70.86 KB |
author: bozbun

comments.content:
It looks like **Columbus** font of Solopedia catalog.  
As you can find here:  
 [http://abfonts.freehostia.com/solopedia/solopedia-c.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014195202/http:/abfonts.freehostia.com/solopedia/solopedia-c.htm "http://abfonts.freehostia.com/solopedia/solopedia-c.htm")  
there are many other digital versions of this font:  
**Columbus** (Sam Wang, Brendel/B&PGraphics),  
**Wedgewood** (Brendel),  
**Deneane** (FontBank),  
**Cowan** (Opti),  
**C790 Deco** (Softmaker),  
**Tringle** (WSI),  
**Jazzy 50** (Fantazia),  
**Beaumarchais** (Scriptorium)

...and an interesting note:

> Tom Phinney is developing a high-quality version named Cristoforo.  
> Original design is by Ihlenberg, 1892.

Is Tom Phinney actually completed his **[Cristoforo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014195202/http:/www.thomasphinney.com/2012/05/cristoforo-lives-kickstarter-ntern/)** font?  
I really don't know...

definitely hand-drawn. felt tip marker too. i'm at a loss for suggestions.  
edit:  
nice work for the above suggestions/links!

Hand drawn but a good rendition. Columbus was designed by Herman Ihlenburg, patented by him in 1892, and sold by MacKellar/American Type Founders.  
For persons not familiar with the Solopedia, it is currently updated monthy by "Character" -- see usenet newsgroup alt.binaries.fonts and is also on the web at the location noted by fvilanakis .  
For anyone interested in the patent it's D22021 which is online at Google Patents and the US Patent Office. Here is the character set shown in the patent:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014195202im_/http:/typophile.com/files/D22021_1892Ihlenburg@MacKellar_Columbus_5429.jpg)
  
Don
